intro: Pseudalbizzia subdimidiata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant has bipinnate leaves that are often narrowly elliptic, and it produces yellow flowers in spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species suitable for drought-prone areas. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
